info.title: OpenMetadata APIs
info.description: Common types and API definition for OpenMetadata

tags.name: API Collections
tags.description: A `API Collection` is an optional way of grouping API Endpoints that belong to a API Service.

tags.name: API Endpoint
tags.description: A `API Endpoint` is a specific endpoint of an API that is part of an API Collection..

tags.name: Apps
tags.description: Apps marketplace holds to application available for Open-metadata

tags.name: Bots
tags.description: A `Bot` automates tasks, such as ingesting metadata, and running data quality It performs this task as a special user in the system.

tags.name: Charts
tags.description: A `Chart` are computed from data presents data visually and can be part of `Dashboards`.

tags.name: Columns
tags.description: Columns represent individual data fields within tables and dashboard data models. This API provides operations to update column metadata such as tags, glossary terms, descriptions, and other properties using the column's fully qualified name.

tags.name: Dashboards
tags.description: Dashboards are computed from data and visually present data, metrics, and KPIs. They are typically updated in real-time and allow interactive data exploration.

tags.name: Data Contracts
tags.description: `DataContract` defines the schema and quality guarantees for a data asset.

tags.name: Databases
tags.description: A `Database` also referred to as `Database Catalog` is a collection of schemas.

tags.name: Database Schemas
tags.description: A `Database Schema` is collection of tables, views, stored procedures, and other database objects.

tags.name: Stored Procedures
tags.description: A `StoredProcedure` entity that contains the set of code statements with an assigned name .

tags.name: Tables
tags.description: `Table` organizes data in rows and columns and is defined in a `Database Schema`.

tags.name: Dashboard Data Models
tags.description: `Data Models` are the schemas used to build dashboards, charts, or other data assets.

tags.name: Document Store
tags.description: A `Document` is an generic entity in OpenMetadata.

tags.name: Domains
tags.description: A `Data Product` or `Data as a Product` is a logical unit that contains all components to process and store domain data for analytical or data-intensive use cases made available to data consumers.

tags.name: Test Case Incident Manager
tags.description: APIs to test case incident status from incident manager.

tags.name: Test Cases
tags.description: Test case is a test definition to capture data quality tests against tables, columns, and other data assets.

tags.name: Test Case Results
tags.description: Test case results are the results of running a test case on a dataset. This resource provides APIs to manage test case results.

tags.name: Test Definitions
tags.description: `Test Definition` is a definition of a type of test using which test cases are created that run against data to capture data quality.

tags.name: Test Suites
tags.description: `TestSuite` is a set of test cases grouped together to capture data quality.

tags.name: Directories
tags.description: A `Directory` is a folder or organizational unit in a Drive Service that can contain files, spreadsheets, and other directories.

tags.name: Files
tags.description: A `File` is a document or resource stored in a Drive Service.

tags.name: Spreadsheets
tags.description: A `Spreadsheet` is a file format for organizing data in a tabular format, like Google Sheets or Excel files.

tags.name: Worksheets
tags.description: A `Worksheet` is an individual sheet or tab within a Spreadsheet.

tags.name: Events
tags.description: The `Events` are changes to metadata and are sent when entities are created, modified, or updated. External systems can subscribe to events using event subscription API over Webhooks, Slack, or Microsoft Teams.

tags.name: Feeds
tags.description: Feeds API supports `Activity Feeds` and `Conversation Threads`.

tags.name: Suggestions
tags.description: Suggestions API supports ability to add suggestion for descriptions or tag labels for Entities.

tags.name: Glossaries
tags.description: A `Glossary` is collection of hierarchical `GlossaryTerms`.

tags.name: Workflow Definitions
tags.description: A `Workflow Definition` is a configured workflow setup for a given governance task.

tags.name: Workflow Instances
tags.description: A Workflow Instance is a specific instance of a Workflow Definition.

tags.name: Workflow Instance States
tags.description: A Workflow Instance State is a specific state of a Workflow Instance.

tags.name: Lineage
tags.description: The `Lineage` for a given data asset, has information of the input datasets used and the ETL pipeline that created it.

tags.name: Metrics
tags.description: `Metrics` are measurements computed from data such as `Monthly Active Users`. Some of the metrics that measures used to determine performance against an objective are called KPIs or Key Performance Indicators, such as `User Retention`.

tags.name: ML Models
tags.description: `Machine Learning Models` are algorithms trained on data to find patterns or make predictions.

tags.name: Permissions
tags.description: APIs related to getting access permission for a User.

tags.name: Pipelines
tags.description: A `Pipeline` enables the flow of data from source to destination through a series of processing steps. ETL is a type of pipeline where the series of steps Extract, Transform and Load the data.

tags.name: Policies
tags.description: A `Policy` defines control that needs to be applied across different Data Entities.

tags.name: Query Cost Record Manager
tags.description: APIs to query cost records from usage workflow.

tags.name: Queries
tags.description: A `Query` entity represents a SQL query associated with data assets it is run against.

tags.name: Reports (beta)
tags.description: `Reports` are static information computed from data periodically that includes data in text, table, and visual form.

tags.name: SCIM
tags.description: SCIM 2.0 compliant user and group provisioning endpoints.

tags.name: Search
tags.description: APIs related to search and suggest.

tags.name: SearchIndex
tags.description: A `SearchIndex` is a index mapping for indexing documents in a `Search Service`.

tags.name: Drive Services
tags.description: `Drive Service` is a cloud file storage service such as Google Drive, OneDrive, SharePoint, Box, or Dropbox where documents, spreadsheets, and other files are stored.

tags.name: API Services
tags.description: APIs related `API Service` entities, such as REST or MicroService.

tags.name: Database Services
tags.description: `Database Service` is a service such as MySQL, BigQuery, Redshift, Postgres, or Snowflake. Alternative terms such as Database Cluster, Database Server instance are also used for database service.

tags.name: Ingestion Pipelines
tags.description: APIs related pipelines/workflows created by the system to ingest metadata.

tags.name: Metadata Services
tags.description: APIs related to creating and managing other Metadata Services that OpenMetadata integrates with such as `Apache Atlas`, `Amundsen`, etc.

tags.name: Search Services
tags.description: APIs related `Search Service` entities, such as ElasticSearch, OpenSearch.

tags.name: Security Services
tags.description: APIs related to Security Service entities, such as Apache Ranger.

tags.name: Object Store Services
tags.description: APIs related `Object Store Service` entities, such as S3, GCS or AZURE.

tags.name: Containers
tags.description: A Container is an abstraction for any path(including the top level eg. bucket in S3) storing data in an Object store such as S3, GCP, Azure. It maps a tree-like structure, where each Container can have a parent and a list of sub-folders, and it can be structured - where it contains structured data, or unstructured where no schema for its data is defined.

tags.name: Classifications
tags.description: These APIs are related to `Classification` and `Tags`. A `Classification` entity contains hierarchical terms called `Tags` used for categorizing and classifying data assets and other entities.

tags.name: Personas
tags.description: A `Persona` is to represent job function a user does.  OpenMetadata uses Persona to define customizable experience in the UI.

tags.name: Roles
tags.description: A `Role` is a collection of `Policies` that provides access control. A user or a team can be assigned one or multiple roles that provide privileges to a user and members of a team to perform the job function.

tags.name: Teams
tags.description: A `Team` is a group of zero or more users and/or other teams. Teams can own zero or more data assets. Hierarchical teams are supported `Organization` -> `BusinessUnit` -> `Division` -> `Department`.

tags.name: Users
tags.description: A `User` represents a user of OpenMetadata. A user can be part of 0 or more teams. A special type of user called Bot is used for automation. A user can be an owner of zero or more data assets. A user can also follow zero or more data assets.

tags.name: Topics
tags.description: A `Topic` is a feed or an event stream in a `Messaging Service` into which publishers publish messages and consumed by consumers.

tags.name: Metadata
tags.description: These APIs are for adding new `Types` to OpenMetadata and use those `Types` to extend the metadata of an entity with custom properties.

tags.name: Usage
tags.description: APIs related usage of data assets.

tags.name: System
tags.description: APIs related to System configuration and settings.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description:
Search Query Text, Pass *text* for substring match; Pass without wildcards for exact match.
1. For listing all tables or topics pass q=*
2. For search tables or topics pass q=*search_term*
3. For searching field names such as search by columnNames pass q=columnNames:address, for searching deleted entities, use q=deleted:true
4. For searching by tag names pass q=tags.tagFQN:user.email
5. When user selects a filter pass q=query_text AND tags.tagFQN:user.email AND platform:MYSQL
6. Search with multiple values of same filter q=tags.tagFQN:user.email AND tags.tagFQN:user.address
NOTE: logic operators such as AND, OR and NOT must be in uppercase

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Size field to limit the no.of results returned, defaults to 10

get.description: Search entities using query text. Use query params `from` and `size` for pagination. Use `sort_field` to sort the results in `sort_order`.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description:
Search Query Text, Pass *text* for substring match; Pass without wildcards for exact match.
1. For listing all tables or topics pass q=*
2. For search tables or topics pass q=*search_term*
3. For searching field names such as search by columnNames pass q=columnNames:address , for searching deleted entities, use q=deleted:true
4. For searching by tag names pass q=tags.tagFQN:user.email
5. When user selects a filter pass q=query_text AND q=tags.tagFQN:user.email AND platform:MYSQL
6. Search with multiple values of same filter q=tags.tagFQN:user.email AND tags.tagFQN:user.address
7. Search by service version and type q=service.type:databaseService AND version:0.1
8. Search Tables with Specific Constraints q=tableConstraints.constraintType.keyword:PRIMARY_KEY AND NOT tier.tagFQN:Tier.Tier1
9. Search with owners q=owner.displayName.keyword:owner_name
NOTE: logic operators such as AND, OR and NOT must be in uppercase
